Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2013 01:08PM Irishwfl wrote: Hi, I am in the same boat.  I had my surgical biopsy yesterday to remove ADH and ALH.  I lost my mom to breast cancer also, she was 53 when she died (1980) and about 50 when diagnosed.  I am now 46. i have felt doomed to have bc for sometime now.  But I took the BRCA test and it was negative so that is some positive news. I know how difficult it is not too worry but try to take it one step at a time.  I feel better now that the ADH and AHL have been removed but still worrying about the results of that biopsy.  My breast surgeon did not even suggest a mastectomy and hopefully that will not come up on Monday.
Posts.Title: what atypical cells really mean? lfejohnson1968 leaf

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2013 12:56PM Irishwfl wrote: Hi Scarlett, I am with you waiting on biopsy results, I'll get mine Monday too.  I feel a bit better knowing the atypical cells are out but still worry that they will find more.  I know what you mean about going back and forth between worrying and being calm.  I have to say I am glad right now that I have no kids. My dog doesn't seem to know anthing is going on:) Hang in there.  We will get through this
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2013 04:27PM Irishwfl wrote: Scarlett, I like your approach.  I wish I could find a way to calm my mind.  I have tried reading, TV, podcasts, Itunes U but it hasn't helped.  I have a lumpectomy tomorrow and though I have already had the biopsy and know it is atypcial hyperplasia, I am still worried they may find more.  I think I got about 3 hours of sleep last night because I could not turn my mind off.  It doesn't help that I am having a hysterectomy in two weeks because of the "probably benign" thing on my ovary.  I guess I will sleep after that.
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy tomorrow and trying not to panic scarlettm512 bearcub

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2013 01:50PM Irishwfl wrote: Sorry you are going through this.  I know the waiting sucks.  That seems like a long time for me.  I had my excisional biobsy on a Thursday and had the results on Monday.  I wish I could tell you how to make the waiting easier.  I tried to keep busy, read good books, etc, sometimes it helped and sometimes it didn't.  But know that whatever it you can get through it, I have not had breast cancer but from what I can tell they have gotten much better at treating it. Hang in there. ((((((HUGS))))
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy a week ago chercoco Irishwfl

Posts.Content: Irishwfl wrote: I have atypical ductal hyperplasia and atypical lobular hyperplasia.  A bit freaked, I know it's not cancer but I know it raises my risk.   I am having a open biopsy/lumpectomy on 3/14.  They tell me it won't me much worse than the biopsy.  It's all a bit overwhelming.  Before the mammogram that led to the biopsy my dr. found something on my ovary and it grew.  Long story short on 3/29 a gyn oncologist is doing a hysterectomy. And just for fun, my septic system is not working.  Yee Ha Atleast the breast cancer gene test was negative. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Results Irishwfl Stix

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2013 09:28AM Irishwfl wrote: I know I will be asleep for the procedure, I'm not clear if it will be all the way under or  twilight.  I'll find out Friday.   Either way it will be better the horrid table I was on for the biopsy.  I am thinking that if they every want to do another biopsy I will go straight to this. I am glad that they are doing this quickly.  Right now my plan after this, assuming they don't find anything worse, is increase surveillance I'm not overly worried, just stressed over everything. Bevin, the name is not for Irish Wolfhounds but the dog food commercial with one in I have wanted to meet one.  I couldn't handle the short life span though.
Posts.Title: Results Irishwfl Stix

Posts.Content: Irishwfl wrote: I had an excisional biopsy over 3 weeks ago in my right breast. In the last few days I have had pain where my right breast and arm pit meet. Is it possible that it is from the biopsy? I did not have any pain or restrictions after a few days. I should mention that I had a hysterectomy less than two weeks ago so I have been using my arms more but can't imagine how I could end up with pain there and no where else in my arms. There is no swelling, I have iced it a couple times today not sure if it is helping yet. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional biopsy 3 1/2 weeks ago Irishwfl Irishwfl
i have microcalcifications and I am sick with fear Raineyb Irishwfl

Posts.Content: Irishwfl wrote: I was diagnosed with ADH and ALH in March. I had a hysterectomy shortly after that, for other reasons. So I had some time on my hands. I spend a lot of time online doing research and ended up making my own hair products and changed most of my other beauty products (mostly using the ewg skin deep database) One of the things I was trying to avoid was parabens, then I found out they are in advil! Now I am working on eating better but sometimes I feel like I am spitting in the wind. But when I went for my 6 month f/u mammogram they told me my risk is 48.3%. Yikes. I am wondering what others are doing to lower their risk. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Lowering Risk Irishwfl MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Irishwfl wrote: I had a stereotactic biobsy the other day.  I get the results Monday morning at a dr. appt.  I'm working on not obsessing about it.  I actually have a question about biobsy procedures.  During my biobsy I was face down on a table with my breast thru a hole in the table and the dr. under it.  I don't know if it's because I am small breasted or because they had to go in through the top of my breast, but in order to get my breast low enough they had to take the padding off the table.  With the dip in the center of the table, the pressure was on my bony hips and bony shoulders.  I have never been so uncomfortable in all my life.  One of my shoulders still hurts.  Is there a reason they had to do it in this position?  If I have to do this again (I am guessing I will), I don't want to do like that! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy Irishwfl kathindc

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2013 09:18PM Irishwfl wrote: Hi Lisa, I know how you feel.  I had my exisional biopsy today and in two weeks I am having a total hysterectomy.  So far I've seen 7 different doctors this year!  When I saw my surgeon for the initial biopsy results (ADH and ALH) we discussed options and he recommended increase surveillance.  He did say tamoxifen was an option but he was not recommending it I was concerned about going under anesthesia twice so close together but today for the excisional they only used twilight.  To tell the truth, since I had not slept well, it was awesome.  I wanted some to go.  The after pain is a bit worse that the biopsy.  I haven't taken anything yet but I will be taking some Lortab before bed. Hang in there Lisa, I know it is very stessful.  Get the surgical biopsy over and then weigh all your options.
Posts.Title: ADH Biopsy Surgery coming Up :-( NY_Lisa SueInMN

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2013 03:55PM Irishwfl wrote: Wow, that skinny table sounds crazy.  The doctor I am seeing to get my results tomorrow is a surgeon so I plan to ask why it was done that way and if it could have been done another way.
